description: GeoEye-1 is an Earth-imaging satellite operated by Maxar of the United States which launched 6 September 2008 and remains operational. The satellite is included in the WorldView constellation, which consists of the four WorldView satellites and GeoEye-1. The satellite imagery is used for a variety of purposes, including but not limited to defence, disaster response, air and marine transportation, oil and gas exploration, mining production and exploration, mapping of remote regions, location-based services, insurance and risk management, agricultural crop management and more. GeoEye-1 can revisit any point on Earth once every three days, or even sooner depending on latitude and elevation angle.

links.title: Glacier Mass Balance Intercomparison Exercise (GlaMBIE) Dataset

title: GeoEye-1
